name: How to get your data on opendata.swiss
tagline: Information and guidance for the production portal for Swiss open government data
body:
last modified: 21.09.2015

**By the end of 2015 the Swiss open government data _pilot_ portal [opendata.admin.ch](http://opendata.admin.ch) will be replaced by the _production_ portal «opendata.swiss». Below you can find further information and guidance relevant for this transition to both data publishers and engineers in their organisations.**

If ‹open data› is new to you, you can find further information about what it is, and what it is good for on [opendefinition.org](http://opendefinition.org).

Jump directly to information and guidance for:

* [Potential open data publishers](#1.-you-are-a-potential-open-data-publisher)
* [Interested engineers, who are managing data](#2.-you-are-an-interested-engineer)

***
# 1. You are a potential open data publisher

## Get ready to publish open data!
In April 2014 the Swiss Federal Council adopted the [Open-Government-Data-Strategy Switzerland 2014–2018](http://www.egovernment.ch/umsetzung/00881/00883/index.html?lang=en&download=NHzLpZeg7t,lnp6I0NTU042l2Z6ln1ad1IZn4Z2qZpnO2Yuq2Z6gpJCDdYF_fWym162epYbg2c_JjKbNoKSn6A--). 

All communal, cantonal, and federal authorities (cities, cantons, offices, regions, interfederal organisations etc.), as well as communal, cantonal, and federal businesses (e.g. SBB, Post, Swisscom etc.) are called on to make data available in open, machine-readable formats, while continuing to ensure privacy and security.

Opendata.swiss is the production portal, which will replace the pilot portal [opendata.admin.ch](http://opendata.admin.ch) by the end of this year, implementing the decisions taken by the ‹Open Government Data› project organisation under the leadership of the [Swiss Federal Archives SFA](http://www.bar.admin.ch/themen/01648/01968/index.html?lang=en) in the pilot phase.

## How can I publish my data on opendata.swiss?
You need to publish standardised data about your data, so-called metadata.
For publishers, opendata.swiss offers three ways to add their datasets to the metadata catalogue:

| Use case                            | Solution          |
|-------------------------------------|-------------------| 
| _I want to publish certain datasets, which are updated at rare intervals._  | I manually submit my metadata through a web page on opendata.swiss. | 
| _I want to publish several datasets and/or datasets which are updated regularly._ | I manually import my metadata by uploading an [XML file](http://dcat-ap-switzerland.readthedocs.org/en/latest/upload.html) on opendata.swiss.  | 
| _I want to publish a large number of datasets and/or datasets which are updated frequently._  | I automatically import my metadata running a metadata harvester. I can use a [standard harvester](http://dcat-ap-switzerland.readthedocs.org/en/latest/harvester.html) on opendata.swiss or custom-develop my own.  | 

## These data publishers are ready for opendata.swiss:

* [Federal Spatial Data Infrastructure FSDI](http://www.geo.admin.ch/internet/geoportal/en/home/geoadmin/mission/bgdi.html)
* [Kanton Zürich, Geographisches Informationssystem GIS-ZH, Geometadaten - GeoLion](http://geolion.zh.ch/opendata)
* [Swiss Federal Archives SFA](http://www.bar.admin.ch/themen/01648/index.html?lang=en)

## These data publishers are evaluating how to get ready for opendata.swiss:

* [Federal Office of Public Health FOPH](http://www.bag.admin.ch/index.html?lang=en)
* [Federal Office of Topography swisstopo](http://www.swisstopo.admin.ch/internet/swisstopo/en/home/products/freeproducts.html)
* [Federal Statistical Office FSO](http://www.bfs.admin.ch/bfs/portal/en/index.html)
* [Statistisches Amt des Kantons Zürich](http://www.statistik.zh.ch/internet/justiz_inneres/statistik/de/daten/opendata.html)
* [Swiss National Library NL](https://www.nb.admin.ch/index.html?lang=en)
* [Système d'information du territoire à Genève SITG](http://ge.ch/sitg/donnees/demarche-open-data)

## These data publishers have expressed interest in getting ready for opendata.swiss:

* [Federal Office for the Environment FOEN](http://www.bafu.admin.ch/index.html?lang=en)
* [Federal Office of Meteorology and Climatology MeteoSwiss](http://www.meteoswiss.admin.ch/home.html?tab=overview)
* [Swiss Federal Railways SBB](http://www.sbb.ch/en/home.html)

## How can I get involved?
Data publishers should contact the opendata.swiss portal team of the Swiss Federal Archives SFA: opendata@bar.admin.ch

## Key members of the opendata.swiss portal team are:

| Role                 | Name              | Function, Organisation             |
|----------------------|-------------------|------------------------------------| 
| Portal owner         | Jean-Luc Cochard  | Head IT, Swiss Federal Archives    |
| ‹Open Government Data› project lead | Juan Pablo Lovato | Swiss Federal Archives   |
| Portal Manager       | Pierre Dumas      | Swiss Federal Archives             |
| Portal Provider      | Andreas Amsler    | Product Owner, Liip Ltd.           |

***

# 2. You are an interested engineer

## What metadata schema do I have to follow?
The ‹Open Government Data› project organisation have worked out a joint solution; see all documents [M8 - Selection and definition of the OGD standards](http://www.egovernment.ch/umsetzung/00881/00883/01112/index.html?lang=en). The portal opendata.swiss implements these standards [as follows](http://dcat-ap-switzerland.readthedocs.org/en/latest/). 

## How can I test if I am ready?

1. Get the [example XML file](https://github.com/ogdch/dcat-ap-docs/blob/master/ogdch_dcatap_import.rdf).
2. Fill the XML file for your metadata following the [documentation](http://dcat-ap-switzerland.readthedocs.org/en/latest/dcat-ap-format.html).
3. Send your XML-file for validation to the portal team: opendata@bar.admin.ch 
4. The portal team gets back to you with feedback.

## I have got an issue. How can I get support?
Please create an issue [here](https://github.com/ogdch/dcat-ap-docs/issues).
